title: Taric can heal J4's flagpole
body: I was playing a ranked game as Taric and misclicked on j4's flag and it gave the particles of healing the flagpole. This may not be game breaking however I think it should be fixed even though I am probably the only person that plays Taric seriously.

Soraka related question, is she supposed to still be able to heal minions and if yes why?
You can "deny" CS if done properly. It really only works early levels, but you can heal a cannon minion to make the other team miss the minion. Its not super common, but I have seen people do it.
It is also good for healing Baron-enhanced cannon minions, or even {{item:3060}} enhanced minions.
I mean these are all good points, but I feel like the ability should at least give priority to champs.
^my main use other then healing champs. 100-0 a tower after just 2 kills at level 6. (none baron or banner enhanced minions that is)
Another very good point.
Hardpush soraka with {{item:3060}} will keep the buffed tower-eating cannon minion alive indefinitely.
Very good point.

Yea but the benefit is arguably low.

Especially considering that it puts an ability on CD that could be used to prevent a death.

Prevent death > denying CS, always.

I have used this tactic over the years on soraka, taric. It is really important especially if you are controlling the lane since you put your opponent back yet even further behind. Typically you would only do this if you are fine sustaining your mana, have no reason to believe the CD will not be back in time, and if the enemy bot lane has weak pressure due to them being bad or you guys just have really good pressure. Benefit = your adc gets his item first if the lane is well and the denying is done correctly. Or prevents the enemy from getting a couple hp pots, which does make a significant difference in terms of controlling the lane or having their supports do more such as expeling more mana. So, yes the benefit is actually quite high.
I never claimed it was an amazing idea. I just said that its a tactic I have seen. Its like reverse support Hecarim, He denies CS, but it's probably not a great idea.

I do this all the time. I took a tower down by myself and one Baron Siege minion. The enemy kept trying to poke it down but I dropped the tower by healing the minion every time. I actually healed so much one time in lane I didn't know where all my heals were going until I stopped targeting minions.
Is it possible that it could still happen with other champions who can heal/shield minions? Karma comes to mind, too. (Not that it isn't hilarious being able to shield the Standard.)
